examples: Lichen plays a vital role in soil formation and ecosystem development.
The heart is a vital organ that pumps blood throughout the body.
Mothers play a vital role in nurturing and shaping their children's lives.
The president singled out education as a vital tool in bridging the gap between rich and poor.
Attachment is vital.
words.defineEn: absolutely necessary and of great importance
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn cần thiết và có tầm quan trọng lớn

examples: The library closes early on Sundays.
She sent the kids to bed early.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
Book early and save £50!
For some people, early morning jogging is their cup of tea.
words.defineEn: happening or done before the usual, expected, or scheduled time
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc thực hiện trước thời gian thông thường, dự kiến, hoặc theo lịch trình

examples: A cup of tea sounds perfect.
The combination of the meatloaf, mashed potatoes, and greens was perfect.
The orange pumpkin was perfect for Halloween.
Good afternoon, the weather is perfect for a walk.
The refreshing Muscat grape juice was the perfect choice for a hot summer day.
words.defineEn: being as great, complete, and flawless as possible
words.defineVi: tuyệt vời, đầy đủ và hoàn hảo nhất có thể

examples: Social workers operate on the razor’s edge.
We study the history of our country in social studies class.
You can also get information on careers in social work from their website.
Mark's reputation as a love rat spread quickly among his social circle, as he had a long history of cheating on his partners.
She was always into sports and social activities, while I was your typical bookworm with very few friends.
words.defineEn: related to society and its citizens' lives in general
words.defineVi: liên quan đến xã hội và cuộc sống của công dân nói chung

examples: The purple flowers in the vase were beautiful.
My mom planted beautiful flowers in the front yard.
It's beautiful!
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
The vibrant purple color of whinberries adds a beautiful touch to desserts like cheesecakes and tarts.
words.defineEn: extremely pleasing to the mind or senses
words.defineVi: cực kỳ dễ chịu cho tâm trí hoặc các giác quan

examples: For the first offence I was given a fine.
There's a fine line between humour and inappropriateness.
Our fine traditions give us a head start on the competition.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
If he wants to play a game of cat and mouse, fine, I'll play.
words.defineEn: not ill, injured, or in a bad state
words.defineVi: không bị bệnh, bị thương, hoặc trong tình trạng xấu

examples: Short hair really becomes you.
The boss has a short fuse these days!
She made short work of her opponents.
We fell short of our goal in the competition.
As they say, short reckonings make long friends.
words.defineEn: having a below-average or small distance between two points
words.defineVi: có khoảng cách dưới trung bình hoặc nhỏ giữa hai điểm

examples: The weather was disagreeably hot.
The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
The factory closure follows hot on the heels of several others
The winter issue is hot off the press.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
words.defineEn: having a high temperature or a high degree of heat
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ cao hoặc nhiệt độ cao

examples: Fireworks displays are common in many countries during the month of July.
Some common types of cooking oils include canola oil, vegetable oil, and sunflower oil.
They shared a common interest in botany.
In my experience, common fame is seldom to blame.
In Spanish culture, it is common to greet others with a kiss on each cheek.
words.defineEn: found or happening often
words.defineVi: tìm thấy hoặc xảy ra thường xuyên

examples: The driver of the car opened the car door for the passengers.
The waiter opened the bottle of wine for the guests.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
right on cue the door opened
The store stays open late on Thursdays.
words.defineEn: letting people or things pass through
words.defineVi: để người hoặc vật đi qua

examples: The brunch special featured a beefburger with a sunny-side-up egg, crispy bacon, and a dollop of hollandaise sauce.
That letter should go by special delivery.
They celebrated the special occasion with a beautifully molded aspic.
The chef's special included a tender beef fillet served on a bed of creamy garlic mash.
The bakery showcased a special maple sugar cake as the highlight of their seasonal menu.
words.defineEn: different from, greater, or better than what is normal
words.defineVi: khác với, lớn hơn hoặc tốt hơn những gì bình thường

examples: My sister's famous sweet cherry jam is a family favorite.
My son's favorite animal is the lion.
The little boy's favorite toy was a blue car.
What is your favorite color?
Our mascarpone cheesecake is a customer favorite
words.defineEn: liked or preferred the most among the rest that are from the same category
words.defineVi: thích hoặc được ưa thích nhất trong số những thứ còn lại cùng loại

examples: The two friends had similar tastes in music, enjoying the same bands and artists.
She and her sister look very similar, but they have very different personalities.
He found two similar shirts in different colors, deciding to buy both.
He inherited his father's love of music and talent for playing the guitar - like father, like son, they share similar interests and skills.
Her success in the industry had opened doors for other women to pursue similar careers.
words.defineEn: (of two or more things) having qualities in common that are not exactly the same
words.defineVi: (của hai hoặc nhiều thứ) có những phẩm chất chung không hoàn toàn giống nhau

examples: To go crazy/mad/nuts/insane.
It’s crazy to make these changes without involving the students.
Her infectious laughter and radiant smile made him crazy.
It drives me crazy seeing all these people just staring at their phones all day long.
Would you stop shouting, you're driving me crazy!
words.defineEn: behaving in a very strange or unusual way
words.defineVi: cư xử theo một cách rất kỳ lạ hoặc bất thường

examples: That nincompoop is going to bankrupt the entire company!
The entire region has been in the grip of a terrible drought.
After the accident, a cloud hung over the entire community for weeks.
You've put our entire business at risk with this ridiculous scheme!
The five candidates spent almost the entire debate ahead of the primaries trading punches.
words.defineEn: involving or describing the whole of something
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc mô tả toàn bộ của một cái gì đó

examples: Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
The coast is clear.
Sanskrit inscriptions are clear as day.
The house rules are crystal clear.
The answers came back clear as a bell.
words.defineEn: easy to understand
words.defineVi: dễ hiểu

examples: Jeans are as American as apple pie.
He sounded American as apple pie.
As an American, she had little truck with the painful formality of English life.
Coca-Cola is a famous American soft drink.
The Statue of Liberty is a famous American landmark.
words.defineEn: relating to the United States or its people
words.defineVi: liên quan đến Hoa Kỳ hoặc người dân của nó

examples: This particular heritage may be a millstone around the neck of scientific natural history.
My particular bête noire is cigarette butts being left in half-empty glasses.
Blue blood is no guarantee of any particular merit, competence, or expertise.
In this particular society men rule the roost and women have a low status and few rights.
In the light of recent incidents, we are asking our customers to take particular care of their personal belongings.
words.defineEn: unique and distinctive among others that are of the same general classification
words.defineVi: duy nhất và khác biệt giữa những người khác thuộc cùng một phân loại chung

examples: The separation from Julie was already difficult for Alex.
The boss always assigns difficult projects as a way of kicking the tires of new employees.
You've given yourselves a difficult task.
It may be too difficult for the trainee - small dog, tall weeds!
It’s difficult to do housework with the children under my feet all the time.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of work or skill to do, understand, or deal with
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều công việc hoặc kỹ năng để làm, hiểu hoặc giải quyết

examples: The strong winds knocked down several trees on the road.
Several chances came our way
The senator held the floor for several hours.
Several candidates were called for a second interview.
The agreement came after several hours of negotiations.
words.defineEn: fewer than many but not less than two
words.defineVi: ít hơn nhiều nhưng không ít hơn hai

examples: The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
The police closed in.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
The library closes early on Sundays.
words.defineEn: near in distance or time; having similarities but not exactly the same
words.defineVi: gần trong khoảng cách hoặc thời gian; có điểm tương đồng nhưng không hoàn toàn giống nhau

examples: Red wine leaves a stain.
The roses in the garden were red with velvety petals.
These shrubs produce bright red berries.
REd algae adds a burst of color to the underwater landscape.
The company has plunged $37 million into the red.
words.defineEn: having the color of tomatoes or blood
words.defineVi: có màu của cà chua hoặc máu

examples: She really is weird, unsympathetic and is useless for the better part of the movie.
A: "Who's that weird guy standing in the corner?"
Audiograms are weird.
The end of the season gets weird.
This texture is weird.
words.defineEn: very strange, unusual, and not natural, in a way that is difficult to understand
words.defineVi: rất lạ, khác thường và không tự nhiên, theo cách khó hiểu

examples: The government makes a big thing out of public support.
The pyramids can be reached by public transport.
Public education campaigns highlight potential health risks of consuming pink slime products.
The government has set strict limits on public spending this year.
Homosexuals in public life are now coming out of the closet.
words.defineEn: of, connected with, or affecting all the people in a society
words.defineVi: của, kết nối với, hoặc ảnh hưởng đến tất cả mọi người trong một xã hội

examples: To take a deep breath.
As I bite into a black cherry, its deep red juice stains my lips, leaving behind a sweet aftertaste.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
He knew deep down inside that she was right.
His deep love of music moved him to take lessons with Dr. Hill.
words.defineEn: having a great distance from the surface to the bottom
words.defineVi: có một khoảng cách lớn từ bề mặt đến đáy
